sentence.Network_cn: 你邀请你的朋友来看电视上的NBA篮球决赛.

sentence.Network_en: The playoff implications alone make this a big game.
sentence.Network_cn: 只有季后赛的含义才使这场比赛变得伟大.

entry.tran: （平分后要决出胜负的）附加赛
entry.def: A playoff is an extra game which is played to decide the winner of a sports competition when two or more people have got the same score.

example.ex: Nick Faldo was beaten by Peter Baker in a play-off.
example.tran: 尼克·福尔多在附加赛中被彼得·贝克击败。

example.ex: ...a playoff game to determine who is the league winner.
example.tran: 决定谁是联赛冠军的附加赛

entry.def: You use playoffs to refer to a series of games between the winners of different leagues, to decide which teams will play for a championship.

example.ex: The winner will face the Oakland A's in the playoffs this weekend.
example.tran: 获胜者将在本周末的季后赛中对阵奥克兰运动者队。

means.word_mean: 1. any final competition to determine a championship
